text: Bomy is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Hauts-de-France region in northern France. It's surrounded by the common Beaumetz-lès-Aire, Erny-Saint-Julien and Laires, Bomy is located 19 km southwest of Saint-Omer's largest city. ==Geography== A village situated 12 miles (19 km) south of Saint-Omer, on the D130 road. It's surrounded by the common Beaumetz-lès-Aire, Erny-Saint-Julien and Laires, Bomy is located 19 km southwest of Saint-Omer, the largest city around."Annuaire-Mairie" ==Population== ==Sights== * The church of St. Vaast, dating from the thirteenth century. * The remains of the old château, where a truce between France and Spain was signed in 1537. * The present-day château. The building dates from 1755. It was confiscated during the French Revolution and sold for use as a sugar beet factory. It was sold again in 1839 to the Baron de Vilmarest.
